com.lows
Class LowsBackgroundAlarmScanner

java.lang.Object
  IntentService
      com.lows.LowsBackgroundAlarmScanner

public class LowsBackgroundAlarmScanner
extends IntentService

This class implements the LoWS Background Scanner Service, this IntentService is executed periodically by the AlarmManager which is set within the LowsActivity class. TODO: -find reason why the background scanner crashes sometimes -move display and search string storage to sqlite -Try to find a way to prevent parsing the Scan Results twice, currently we parse them within the LowsActivity and within this class. -Same as in the LowsActivity, the extended (flexible) LoWS parsing is not complete, currently fragmentation, encryption, signature validation and extended type extraction is not supported, when a way has found to only parse the data once for the BackgroundScanner and the Main LowsActivity, then this should be done.

Author:
Sven Zehl

waitForScanFinished

public void waitForScanFinished()
This function waits till the IEEE 802.11 scan was finished, this is needed to keep the BackgroundScanner alive

scanFinished

public void scanFinished()
This function is called when the full IEEE 802.11 scan was completed (incl. nlscanner binary call) the function simply sets the variable scanFinished to true and therefore ends the waitForScanFinsihed() function.

startNLscanner

void startNLscanner()
Start the nlscanner binary and parse the data

ieParser

Parse the Information Elements stored in the AccessPoint array

lowsParser

public void lowsParser()
This function parses the LoWS and extracts the LoWS raw data Beside, this function starts the Broadcast Intent to notify other applications that new LoWS messages have been found. Further the service data is sent within the Intent

parseReducedLows

public void parseReducedLows(int i,
                             int type)
Parse service data of the reduced LoWS message

Parameters:
i, - index within the LoWS List
type, - LoWS type, e.g. BEPS

public void parseExtendedType(int i)

public void parseExtendedOptionByte(int i)

compareResultWithSearchStrings

void compareResultWithSearchStrings()
This function is called after all LoWS messages have been parsed. The function now compares all the stored LoWS service data with the search strings that have been submitted before. If a match occured a notification is started via the function sendNotification()

sendNotification

void sendNotification(java.lang.String displayMessage,
                      java.lang.String matchString,
                      LoWS matchLows)
This function is called from the compareResultWithSearchStrings() function if a match with the search strings occured.

Parameters:
displayMessage, - The message the should be displayed within the notification
matchString, - the string that caused the match
matchLows, - the LoWS that corresponds to the match
